Authors:
Dong Fang Pei, Lai Lai Aung Sein, Hai Feng Liu, Zhi He Yu,
Jian Xin Deng
Title:
A novel species of Alternaria hydrangeae sp. nov. from
Hydrangea paniculata in China
Abstract:
A new species was isolated from necrotic spotted leaves of
Hydrangea paniculata in Shenyang Botanical Garden, Liaoning, China, in
2017. A phylogenetic analysis based on five genes (ITS, GPDH, Alt a1,
RPB2 and TEF1) indicated that the species was closely related with
Alternaria deserticola but clearly fell into distinct evolutionary taxa.
They were significantly different from each other based on cultural
features on SNA and PCA. Besides, A. deserticola was morphologically
considered as A. acalyphicola and separated as a single species based on
multi-gene sequence analysis. In the result of conidial characters, the
species was distinct from A. acalyphicola in conidia shape, size and
transverse septa. Pathogenicity tests indicated that it could induce
necrotic symptoms on its host. In a word, the species was illustrated
here a new species, Alternaria hydrangeae caused leaf spot on H.
paniculata.
